title: Concert attack in Bangladesh: James show cancelled after bricks hurled; 15–20 students injured
description: A concert by Bangladeshi rock star James was cancelled in Faridpur. The event turned violent when outsiders attempted to enter the venue. They threw bricks and stones, injuring at least 25 people, including students. Organisers expressed confusion about the motive behind the attack. The deputy commissioner instructed the cancellation of the performance.

Top 10 extreme weather events cost world more than $122bn in 2025: Report
description: Extreme weather events in 2025 inflicted over $122 billion in global damages, with India and Pakistan's devastating monsoon floods alone costing $5.6 billion and claiming 1,860 lives. While the US faced the highest financial toll from wildfires, poorer nations bore a disproportionate human cost. Experts warn continued fossil fuel use fuels this escalating crisis.

title: U.S. airlines cancel over 1,000 flights due to Northeast winter storm warnings
description: The National Weather Service issued warnings of winter storms this afternoon ​, which “will cause ⁠hazardous travel conditions for the Great Lakes into the northern Mid-Atlantic and southern New England today through Saturday morning.”

title: ‘Doesn’t have anything ’: Trump casts himself as arbiter of peace deal; sceptical of Zelenskyy's plan
description: US President Donald Trump asserted that any Ukraine-Russia peace deal requires his approval, ahead of talks with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy. Trump expressed skepticism about Zelenskyy's peace proposal, emphasizing his ultimate decision-making power. He anticipates constructive discussions with both Zelenskyy and Putin, while also confirming meetings with Israeli PM Netanyahu.

title: Ukrainian capital Kyiv under massive Russian attack, officials say
description: The Russian ​action took ⁠place two days before a meeting Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says ‌he is due ‌to hold in the United States with ‍President Donald Trump to work out details of ‍an accord for settling the nearly four-year-old war pitting Russia against Ukraine.

'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 22: Ranveer Singh starrer storms past 1000cr worldwide
description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered box office records, crossing Rs 1000 crore worldwide in just 22 days. The film's impressive run, bolstered by strong overseas collections, makes it the ninth Indian film to achieve this feat and the first of 2025. Despite an 'A' rating, its success is a significant achievement.

title: Slashed 26 times: Kanpur woman axes husband to death after drunken fight
description: A shocking incident unfolded in Kanpur where a woman, Veerangana, allegedly attacked her husband, Ravishankar Savita, with an axe multiple times following a drunken argument. Their young son was present during the brutal altercation. Veerangana was apprehended by authorities after initially reporting an accident. Investigators are continuing their probe into the violent domestic dispute.

title: Delhi on Khaleda Zia’s son Rahman’s return: Polls must be free, inclusive
On This Day: Ajinkya Rahane’s century that changed Indian cricket
description: Ajinkya Rahane's century at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on December 27, 2020, was a pivotal moment for Indian Test cricket. Following a humiliating defeat, Rahane's resilient innings, marked by calm determination, restored belief and set the stage for a historic series victory against Australia. His performance showcased his ability to deliver under immense pressure.

title: AIADMK extends last date for submission of applications for party ticket to contest poll
description: Two former Ministers C.Ve. Shanmugam and K. Pandiarajan are contemplating changing their constituencies

title: Even low alcohol intake raises oral cancer risk in Indian men: study
description: The study adds to growing evidence that no level of alcohol consumption can be considered risk-free when it comes to cancer

title: NDA government has buried MGNREGA by bringing in a new Act: Chidambaram
description: Making a comparison between the two Acts, Mr. Chidambaram said the MGNREGA was “demand driven”, while the new Act was “supply driven”.

title: CPI seeks compensation or return of land to farmers in Eluru district
description: Party says 340 acres acquired in 2016 for proposed aircraft components unit remain unused, leaving farming families in financial distress, urges government to act immediately

title: Unnao rape case: CBI moves Supreme Court against Delhi high court order
description: The CBI has approached the Supreme Court seeking a stay on the Delhi high court's order suspending the sentence of expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case. The High Court had ruled that Sengar, convicted for raping a minor, was wrongly classified as a public servant.

title: Kennedy Center criticizes musician who canceled performance after Donald Trump’s name added to building
Uttar Pradesh: Hauled up for using AI during exam, girl dies by suicide
description: A Class 10 student died by suicide after allegedly being reprimanded by teachers and the principal at a Greater Noida West school for using AI on her mobile phone during pre-Board exams. Her father has filed a police complaint accusing the school of abetment to suicide and mental harassment.

title: His decision is supreme
India condemns 'hostility' against Bangladesh minorities
description: 'Hindu's killing a matter of grave concern'

title: GCC sets up specific feeding areas for stray dogs in Chennai
description: Designated feeding areas have been demarcated in Ambattur, Anna Nagar, Teynampet, Perungudi, Palavakkam and Thiruvottiyur; senior official says two such areas would be set up in each zone

title: ‘Vendetta’: Delhi HC scraps CISF officer’s forced retirement
description: After two decades of battling a tarnished reputation, a 72-year-old retired CISF officer has won a decisive victory, as the Delhi High Court exonerates him from long-standing sexual harassment allegations.

title: The quiet, deserted meadows of Kashmir
description: Only 28 of the 48 destinations in the Kashmir Valley that were closed after the terror attack in Pahalgam have been reopened. While waiting for the Lieutenant Governor to give clearance to the rest to resume operations, locals who are dependent on tourism for their livelihoods worry about unpaid loans and unsteady jobs. Peerzada Ashiq reports on how the incident continues to impact tourism

title: Only 14! Vaibhav Suryavanshi meets PM Narendra Modi; pic goes viral
description: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, a young cricketer, made headlines in the past year. He received the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar, India's highest civilian honor for young achievers. Sooryavanshi broke several cricket records, including the youngest player to score a century in List A cricket. He also achieved a T20 century at a young age.

title: Himachal Pradesh: Doctors launch indefinite strike after colleague sacked over assault
description: Resident doctors in Himachal Pradesh have launched an indefinite strike, demanding the reinstatement of a doctor sacked for assaulting a patient. Despite a promise of a fresh inquiry, doctors deem the termination unjust, citing a lack of consideration for the doctor's perspective. The protest has disrupted routine medical services across the state.

title: Teenager Krishna Goutham in joint lead with Carlsen after three rounds in World Rapid Championships
description: Goutham overcame Serbian GM Indjic Aleksandar with black pieces, before getting the better of one of the top Indian GM Aravindh Chithambaram with white and then outmanoeuvreing Azerbaijan's Radjabov Teimour

title: Express News Quiz: Aravalli range, Bangladesh unrest & blooming octopus
Standards for incense sticks notified: Govt bans hazardous chemicals; new norms voluntary
description: India has introduced quality standards for incense sticks, prohibiting harmful insecticidal chemicals and synthetic fragrance intermediates.  These new norms, aimed at improving safety and sustainability, classify agarbattis and set requirements for raw materials and burning quality.  The voluntary standard, IS 19412:2025, seeks to protect public health and the environment from potentially hazardous substances.

title: Why the US targeted Islamic State fighters in Nigeria during new military strikes

Smart bulk meters to curb water loss and enable real-time monitoring of city’s supply
description: Once the bulk metering project is completed, Chennai Metrowater will be able to precisely identify water loss, track consumption and monitor drawal and distribution on real-time basis; a total of 277 electromagnetic flow meters have been installed in pipelines at various places in the city

title: Indigo crisis: ‘Exemplary’ action on airline likely as DGCA tables report
description: Government prepares for strong action against IndiGo after a major schedule collapse.  A DGCA report has been submitted to the civil aviation ministry.  This report details the reasons behind the widespread flight disruptions.  The government aims to ensure IndiGo improves its operations.  Steep fines and regulatory scrutiny are anticipated for the airline and some officials.

title: Suraj Sharma sweeps senior and junior 25m rapid fire pistol national titles
description: Rajasthan's Bhavesh Shekhawat rounded off the podium, claiming bronze with a total of 24 hits

title: 'Fully committed': MEA says will bring back all ‘fugitives’ after Lalit mocks govt
description: India is determined to bring back all fugitives wanted for prosecution. The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal confirmed ongoing talks with multiple governments for extradition. Delays in cases like Vijay Mallya and Lalit Modi are due to complex legalities. India remains committed to ensuring these individuals face trial in Indian courts.

title: PSPB sweeps table tennis titles
Hindus form party in Bangladesh; prepare to fight upcoming polls
description: Amidst persecution, Bangladesh Minority Janta Party (BMJP) is set to contest 91 seats in the upcoming polls, targeting Hindu and minority votes. The party president seeks alliances with mainstream parties like BNP to ensure minority safety and urges India to shift its support from Awami League to champion the cause of persecuted Hindus.

title: Rabri Devi may vacate official bungalow after month of Kharmas
PM Rashtriya Bal Puraskar: From Sindoor to sports - stories of valour in the spotlight
description: President Murmu honored 20 young achievers with the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar for their bravery, social service, and talent. Stories like Shavan Singh's support for soldiers and Vansh Tayal's care for an abandoned child highlight remarkable courage and compassion. The awards celebrated exceptional achievements across various fields, inspiring a nation.

title: Students alleges caste discrimination by teachers in Alawalpur village adopted by Ravi Shankar Prasad
description: The Students also alleged that they are forced to do the work which they are not supposed to do like brooming the class, opening the gate, washing their own plates and glasses after mid-day meal and shutting the doors and windows after the classes get over

title: Very good sign when a player can actually win events, not just keep a high rating: Caruana
description: As the world’s third-best chess player at the moment — also the third-highest-rated player in history — Caruana has lofty standards. It’s perhaps why the 33-year-old says he isn’t happy with his 2025, despite winning big events. In this chat, he also speaks about the Global Chess League, the Candidates, India’s young prodigies and the origin of his fascination with tennis.

title: Twenty20 vision: SKY the limit after India’s Gill course correction
description: In its bid to win the format’s pinnacle event back to back, the team management has resorted to a last-ditch reshuffle at the top. Dropping the Test and ODI captain is a tacit admission that the think tank’s strategy was not quite in order. But despite the drastic measure and T20I skipper Suryakumar’s poor form, the squad has the batting muscle and bowling venom to defend its title

title: Horoscope Today for 27 December 2025: Key Astrological Trends Affecting Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and Other Zodiac Signs
Uttar Pradesh: 19% voters 'uncollectable' as SIR enumeration ends
description: Uttar Pradesh faces a significant challenge with 2.89 crore voters deemed 'uncollectable' during a special revision. This includes those who have shifted, passed away, or are untraceable. Lucknow alone saw 12 lakh voters uncollectable. The state aims for a clean electoral roll by February 2026, with draft lists due December 31, 2025.

title: J&K HC court order on PIL related to undertrials surprising, unfortunate: Mehbooba
description: She said the court was the last resort for her “to ensure that undertrials who have no serious charges” are brought back to Kashmir

title: Saudi Arabia, not the US, deported the highest number of Indians in 2025

title: Israel becomes first country to formally recognise Somaliland as independent state

title: Disintegration talk is rumour-mongering, BJD will survive for generations: Naveen Patnaik
description: The regional party dismisses possible announcement of successor to Mr. Patnaik on its 29th foundation day as mischief

title: Vajpayee: The statesman who taught India to dream big
description: Atal Bihari Vajpayee, a statesman and former Prime Minister, is remembered for his blend of courage, compassion, and inclusiveness. His legacy of effective, corruption-free governance and concern for the common man continues to inspire transformative changes. Vajpayee's simplicity, sensitivity, and poetic nature endeared him to all, leaving an indelible mark on India's democratic journey.

title: Fire engulfs plywood factory in Perumbavoor
Theatre camp begins in Kozhikode
White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt announces second pregnancy
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt announced she is expecting her second child, a baby girl due in May. She expressed joy in growing her family and her son becoming a big brother. Leavitt also thanked President Trump and White House chief of staff Susie Wiles for their support and for fostering a pro-family environment.

title: Acting on 'sixth sense', Supreme Court quashes rape conviction
description: The Supreme Court, guided by a 'sixth sense,' intervened in a rape conviction case. Observing a consensual relationship that soured, the court facilitated a marriage between the convict and victim. Following their union and happy cohabitation, the apex court quashed the 10-year conviction, invoking its powers to deliver complete justice.

title: SHRC seeks action against road safety violations in city
Over 33,000 meals served in Atal Canteens in two days: CMO
Amit Shah calls for creation of ‘anti-terrorism grid’; urges common ATS
description: Union home minister Amit Shah has called for a nationwide upgrade of anti-terror infrastructure, advocating for an "impenetrable anti-terrorism grid" and a common ATS structure across states. He also announced a "360-degree strike" plan against organised crime, emphasizing data sharing and technological integration to combat evolving threats and ensure future security.

title: Govt. mulling revival of shared cab rides to curb pollution: CM

PM Modi lauds Sahibzadas' supreme sacrifice; vows to end 'slave mentality' in 10 years
description: Prime Minister Modi lauded the Sahibzadas' supreme sacrifice as a testament to India's courage against religious fanaticism. He emphasized that their story, suppressed for decades due to a colonial mindset, is now being brought to the forefront.

title: Special drive under way to track drunk driving in Kozhikode city
description: SoToxa machines have been made available for the enforcement wings for conducting rapid screening of suspected drivers

title: Thiruvananthapuram mayoral election: BJP wins top post; to govern city for first time
description: In a significant political development, the BJP has secured its maiden mayoral victory in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram Municipal Corporation. V V Rajesh, a seasoned party leader, clinched the top post with crucial support, marking the NDA's first governance of a city corporation in the state.

title: Meat, liquor ban in Golden Temple zone rattles Amritsar biz; families fear job loss
description: Generations-old trades now face uncertainty

title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Bulls? Latest 76ers injury update
description: Joel Embiid's status for the Philadelphia 76ers' December 26, 2025, game against the Chicago Bulls remains uncertain due to ongoing right knee management. The Sixers face a short-handed roster with multiple players out or ill, while the Bulls are near full strength, creating pressure for Philadelphia in the Eastern Conference standings.

title: Clearance of cosmetic sold to treat medical conditions nixed
description: India's drug regulator has revoked the registration of QR 678-Neo, an anti-hair loss product. The cosmetic was illegally marketed online for treating medical conditions like post-chemotherapy hair loss and genetic baldness. This action by the CDSCO against M/s Esthetic Centers International Pvt Ltd serves as a stern warning to the booming cosmetic market about making unapproved therapeutic claims.

title: Ilia Topuria vs Alex Pereira net worth 2025: Who’s richer in the UFC?
description: Ilia Topuria and Alex Pereira are two of the UFC’s biggest names in 2025. Alex Pereira leads in net worth thanks to longer time in main events and title fights. Ilia Topuria is rising fast after winning gold in 2024. Both continue building legacies and strong earnings inside the UFC.

title: Vizag Airport records 81.52% punctuality of flights

Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is ready for a referendum if Russia agrees on ceasefire
Child rapist-killer must be jailed till 'virility sunset': Punjab and Haryana high court
description: A man convicted of raping and murdering a five-year-old girl will spend 30 years in prison without remission. The Punjab and Haryana High Court commuted his death sentence, stating his incarceration is necessary to prevent future crimes. The court emphasized the need for societal change to protect children and women from such barbaric acts.

title: Hair-loss drug under lens over threat to infants, eye disorders
description: A global safety analysis of minoxidil, a common hair loss treatment, revealed over 45 infant cases of excessive hair growth due to unintended exposure. The study also flagged more than 1,600 eye-related side effects worldwide, including serious conditions. Researchers urge better oversight and awareness due to the drug's widespread availability.

title: Ayesha Curry admits 'escaping' her four kids amid resurfaced remarks
description: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, has been in the spotlight over the last few months due to her controversial remarks about not wanting a marriage and children when she was young. While these comments had sparked outrage, Ayesha Curry had also opened up about how she takes time off from being a mother.

description: Home Minister A. Namassivayam was addressing presspersons after a review meeting with the police top brass

title: MLA told to vacate office
Jammu and Kashmir: Fisherman recovers stone sculpture of goddess Durga from Jhelum
description: A fisherman's routine catch in the Jhelum River led to a significant discovery: a stone sculpture of goddess Durga. Recovered in Baramulla, the ancient artifact was promptly handed over to the archaeology department by the Jammu and Kashmir Police. This incident highlights the region's rich cultural heritage and the police's commitment to its preservation, encouraging citizens to report similar finds.

description: Among the new 59 accused are former Deputy Secretary at Chief Minister's office Soumya Chaurasia, former IAS officer Niranjan Das, liquor licence holders, liquor manufacturers and excise department officials

description: Three women suffered minor injuries after a knife attack on Paris Metro's Line 3 Friday afternoon. The assaults occurred at Arts-et-Métiers, République, and Opéra stations. title: Bangladesh unrest: Please save us, open borders - Hindus send SOS from Dhaka
description: Hindus in Bangladesh are pleading with India to open its borders, fearing escalating violence and persecution following recent lynchings. Activists criticize Indian Hindu organizations for inaction, warning of a potential 'holocaust' if borders remain closed.

title: Travis Kelce reveals Taylor Swift habit that quietly improved his health

Swift's sourdough baking and healthier eating habits have significantly improved Kelce's gut health and overall well-being, showcasing a grounded side of the athlete as they build a life together through simple, shared rituals.

title: Jordan Spieth net worth 2025: How the golf star built his fortune
description: Jordan Spieth, a celebrated American golfer, boasts a remarkable career. He has secured three major championships and the FedEx Cup. Spieth's earnings stem from tournament wins, lucrative brand deals, and sponsorships. He continues to compete actively on the PGA Tour. Off the course, he supports charitable causes through his foundation.

title: Frank Lampard & Christine Lampard net worth 2025: Football, TV success
description: Former Chelsea star Frank Lampard, a decorated player and manager, has achieved significant success in football. His wife, Christine Lampard, is a highly recognized and versatile TV presenter. Despite their public profiles, the couple prioritizes their children, maintaining a combined net worth estimated at £100 million through their respective careers and investments.

title: Can Ilia Topuria beat Chimaev and Pereira? Urijah Faber explains
description: Urijah Faber believes Ilia Topuria has the best chance to become the UFC’s first triple champion. Speaking on December 24, Faber praised Topuria’s power and mindset. While Alex Pereira and Khamzat Chimaev are also in the mix, Topuria’s comments about Islam Makhachev keep his title dreams alive.
